item.title: 3G Rollout: The Future of Mobile Communication
item.description: Moving to Motorola In 2002, I left academia and joined Motorola Mobile Devices. The timing was perfect. Motorola was at the center of the 3G revolutionâ€”the transition from 2G networks (which enabled SMS and basic data) to 3G networks (which promised high-speed data and multimedia). The 3G Vision The promise was intoxicating. Imagine a mobile phone that could stream video, enable real-time applications, support navigation and location services. 3G would deliver megabits per second instead of kilobits.
